intro: Amphitecna fonceti, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Amphitecna fonceti prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
